extlib package

Submodules

extlib.dodis module

Dodis is a 2-source extractor that takes two equal length, independent, strings of bits to produce some error-perfect random bits.

class extlib.dodis.Dodis[source]

Bases: object

Dodis extractor

__init__()[source]

Create a Dodis Extractor

classmethod calc_params(input_length2: int, entropy1: int, entropy2: int, error: int, q_proof: bool) → tuple[source]

Calculate the input size and output size for this 2-source extractor.

The input_length -1 must be in na_set(). The entropy inputs are a lower bound on the min-entropy of the related input string.

Parameters
input_length1int

The initial length of input source 1.

input_length2int

The initial length of input source 2.

entropy1int

The min-entropy of input source 1.

entropy2int

The min-entropy of input source 2.

errorint

The acceptable maximum extractor error, in the form error = b where extractor error = \(2 ^ b\).

q_proofbool

Boolean indicator of whether the extractor parameters should be calculated to account for quantum side information or not.

Returns
int

The length parameter for input source 1.

int

The length parameter for input source 2.

int

The length parameter for the output from the extractor.

extract() → list[bool][source]

Extract randomness

extlib.hayashi module

Hayashi is a seeded extractor that takes two differing length, independent, strings of bits to produce some error-perfect random bits.

class extlib.hayashi.Hayashi[source]

Bases: object

Hayashi extractor

__init__()[source]

Create a Hayashi Extractor

classmethod calc_parameters(entropy_rate: float, error: int, q_proof: bool) → tuple[source]

Calculate the input size and output size for this seeded extractor.

The seed_length must be in na_set(). The second input source must be Santha-Vazirani. Namely, all input bits have the same min-entropy rate.

Parameters:
seed_lengthint

The initial length of the seed.

entropy_rateint

The min-entropy rate of the second input source.

errorint

The acceptable maximum extractor error, in the form error = b where extractor error = 2 ^ b.

q_proofbool

Whether the extractor parameters should be calculated to account for quantum side information or not.

Returns:
int

The length parameter for input seed.

int

The length parameter for input second source.

int

The length parameter for the output from the extractor.

extract() → list[bool][source]

Extract randomness

extlib.utils module

This is a module.

extlib.utils.is_prime(n: int) → bool[source]

Checks an integer for primality.

Parameters
nint

integer to check for primality

Returns
boolWhether n is prime.
extlib.utils.na_set(k: int) → int[source]

Ensure the number of runs falls within the correct set: i.e. that we run enough times.

Parameters
kint

number to check is in the set.

Returns
int

This number +1 is in na_set.

extlib.utils.prime_facto(n: int) → Tuple[List[int], List[int]][source]

Defines the factors of the prime numbers used. It is required for the later function: na_set.

Parameters
nint

number to check

Returns
list

Returns factors and powers.
